intro: Angorkis saccifera, commonly known as the bladderpod or sac-like pod plant, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its unique, inflated pods that resemble small sacs, which help in seed dispersal. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are often narrow and hairy, reducing water loss through transpiration. Angorkis saccifera is also known for its small, white or yellow flowers that bloom in clusters.
